title: Golden Gate National Recreation Area: Public Meetings for Proposed Rule on Dog Management
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Planning     Dog Management Planning     Public Meetings for Proposed Rule on Dog Management                Public Meetings for the Proposed Rule for Dog Management in the GGNRA             The Golden Gate National Recreation Area (GGNRA) hosted six public informational meetings on the Proposed Rule for Dog Management in the GGNRA between March 22-31, 2016.  Over 600 people participated in these meetings in Marin, San Francisco, and San Mateo Counties.   Public Recording and Presentation Video recordings of the March 23, 2016, formal presentation by Superintendent Chris Lehnertz as well as the corresponding sixty minute question and answer period are available here.   A copy of the Powerpoint presentation is available here.     Click here to view the March 2016 Proposed Rule for Dog Management public meeting agenda.   ______________________________________________________________________________________ Dog Management Planning Links     Information on the Proposed Rule for Dog Management in the GGNRA Visit www.regulations.gov (RIN 1024-AE16) to read and comment on the Proposed Rule for Dog Management in the GGNRA. Dog Management Planning Timeline Maps under the Proposed Rule for Dog Management in the GGNRA   Stay Informed Sign up here to receive e-mail notifications about dog management planning, public meetings, and other general information.
